intro: Cleisostoma iloconense, commonly known as the Ilocon nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades and tomatoes. The plant produces small, white or pale purple flowers that are typically nocturnal, opening at night. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Cleisostoma iloconense is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
